meanings.definition: To select or choose from a group
meanings.sent1: She picked a red apple from the tree.
meanings.sent2: The team captain picked the best player for the match.
meanings.sent3: The little girl picked her favorite toy from the shelf.
meanings.sent4: He picked the winning lottery numbers from the list.
meanings.sent5: The chef carefully picked the freshest ingredients for the dish.

meanings.definition: To remove something with one's fingers or a tool
meanings.sent1: He picked the splinter from his finger.
meanings.sent2: She picked the flower petals off the stem.
meanings.sent3: The monkey picked the bugs off its fur.
meanings.sent4: The detective picked the lock to enter the room.
meanings.sent5: The gardener picked the weeds from the flower bed.

meanings.definition: To pluck or gather by hand
meanings.sent1: She picked a daisy from the field.
meanings.sent2: He picked the grapes from the vine.
meanings.sent3: The child picked seashells along the shore.
meanings.sent4: The farmer picked fresh vegetables from the garden.
meanings.sent5: The hiker picked wild berries from the bushes.

meanings.definition: To clean or prepare by removing unwanted items
meanings.sent1: She picked the bones from the fish before cooking.
meanings.sent2: He picked the leaves from the salad.
meanings.sent3: The tailor picked the loose threads from the fabric.
meanings.sent4: The artist picked the imperfections from the sculpture.
meanings.sent5: The teacher picked the incorrect answers from the test.

meanings.definition: To steal or take without permission
meanings.sent1: The thief picked the wallet from the unsuspecting victim.
meanings.sent2: She picked the idea from her colleague without credit.
meanings.sent3: He picked the cookies from the jar when no one was looking.
meanings.sent4: The bird picked the shiny object from the ground for its nest.
meanings.sent5: The bully picked the lunch money from the younger student.
